subject: Skiing
lead_paragraph: Kalle Palander of Finland got his third career giant slalom victory on the Gran Risa course in Alta Badia, Italy, and the American Ted Ligety skied the fastest second run to finish fifth.Palander led the first run and his two-run combined time of 2:30.92 was enough to hold off Austria’s Benjamin Raich, the Olympic giant slalom champion, by 0.42 seconds.Ligety, who leads the giant slalom standings, was penalized by the International Ski Federation for showing up four minutes late to Saturday’s public draw. By rule, he was forced to start 46th instead of within the top 15 and was fined $867. (AP).
